# Contributing Guidelines

## Our Community
This repository is part of the Niagaros open-source ecosystem. We welcome contributors of all backgrounds and experience levels. Our goal is to build reliable, transparent, and inclusive security software for modern infrastructure companies.

Participation in this project implies agreement with these standards.

## Expected Behavior
All contributors are expected to:

- Be respectful and professional in all interactions
- Assume good intent from others
- Provide constructive feedback, not personal criticism
- Be open to discussion, suggestions, and alternative solutions
- Communicate clearly and thoughtfully, especially in code reviews
- Respect differing viewpoints and experiences

## Unacceptable Behavior
The following behaviors are not tolerated:

- Harassment, discrimination, or offensive language
- Personal attacks, insults, or threats
- Trolling, baiting, or deliberately disruptive behavior
- Publishing private or sensitive information without consent
- Repeatedly ignoring project guidelines or maintainers’ requests

## Contribution Standards
To keep the project maintainable and high-quality:

- Follow the project’s coding standards and conventions
- Keep pull requests focused and well-scoped
- Write clear commit messages and PR descriptions
- Add or update documentation when behavior or APIs change
- Include tests when applicable
- Do not introduce breaking changes without discussion

## Code Reviews & Discussions
- Reviews should focus on code quality, security, and maintainability
- Disagreements are normal—resolve them respectfully and fact-based
- Maintainers have final decision authority to protect project integrity

## Reporting Issues
If you experience or witness unacceptable behavior:

- Report it privately to the project maintainers
- Provide context, links, or screenshots where possible
- All reports will be reviewed discreetly and fairly

## Enforcement
Project maintainers may take action when these standards are violated, including:

- Requesting changes or apologies
- Temporarily limiting participation
- Removing content or access
- Permanent bans in severe or repeated cases

Actions will be proportional, transparent where possible, and focused on community health.

## Scope
These standards apply to:

- This repository and its related repositories
- Issues, pull requests, discussions, and code reviews
- Official project communication channels

## A Shared Responsibility
A strong community is built together. By contributing, you help shape not just the code, but the culture of Niagaros.

Thank you for being part of it.
